roleset.name: make excited, stimulating

example.name: excited-j: passive as adjective
example.text: `` There may be sticker - shock reaction initially , '' said Mr. Pratt , `` but as the wine is talked about and starts to sell , they eventually get excited and decide it 's worth the astronomical price to add it to their collection . ''

propbank.arg: as the wine is talked about and starts to sell

example.name: excite-v: transitive as 'cause'
example.text: Even without bid talk , this year 's surge in prices for Brussels real estate has excited interest in AG .

propbank.arg: this year 's surge in prices for Brussels real estate

example.name: excitement-n
example.text: The May 20th inaugural was accompanied by an air of excitement and rejoicing , accented nicely by the flying pennants and milling crowds .

example.name: excitement-n: arg 1 of annotation)
example.text: According to the suit , Apple officials created public excitement by touting Lisa as an office computer that would revolutionizethe workplace and be extremely successful in its first year .

example.name: exciting-j
example.text: I like Haye because he 's fresh and quite exciting .

example.name: exciting-j: args 0,2
example.text: David was exciting , with his big Harley and dual tattoos on his arms .

propbank.arg: with his big Harley and dual tattoos on his arms

roleset.note: EXCITE-V NOTES: I do try to keep these things PG-rated, after all. (from excite.01-v)
EXCITEMENT-N NOTES: Based on nouns-00080. Comparison to 'excite.01'. Vn class amuse-31.1. Framed by Katie. (from excitement.01-n)
EXCITING-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, excite-v.01.Corresponds to VNcls amuse-31.1. (from exciting.01-j)
EXCITED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on medi-tmprl1to8 (from excited.01-j)
